Origins of the photo: The expert mentions that the origins of the photo are still unclear, but it was first posted on the internet on a website called Live Leak in July 2014. This aspect suggests that the authenticity of the claim can be verified by investigating the source and credibility of the photo.
Similar claims: The expert mentions that a similar claim accompanied the photo when it was first posted on Live Leak. This aspect suggests that the authenticity of the claim can be verified by looking for any other instances or sources that support or refute the claim.
Admission of trolling: The expert mentions that the original uploader of the photo on Live Leak admitted in the comment section that the photo was posted as a form of trolling and that Obama was not actually pictured in the image. This aspect suggests that the authenticity of the claim can be discredited based on the admission of the uploader.
Age of Abu Bakr al: Baghdadi: The expert points out that Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi would have been between the ages of 10 and 12 in the 1980s when the photo was allegedly taken. This aspect suggests that the authenticity of the claim can be questioned based on the age discrepancy and the likelihood of al-Baghdadi being present in the photo.
